title: spec: "special form" description of comma-ok assignments is incomplete
body:
The spec refers to "special forms" of assignments such as
```
v, ok = x.(T)
v, ok := x.(T)
var v, ok = x.(T)
```
etc. For completeness it should also mention
```
var v, ok T = x.(T)
```
where T is a type. (The only possible type is a boolean type, though).
